attributes.action: Recognise all NHS Staff who lost their lives due to COVID-19 as national heroes
attributes.additional_details:
Unfortunately, some have lost their lives to save ours. The least we can do is to recognise their bravery, courage, and sacrifice, by giving the status of National Heroes.
For example, the Victoria Cross medal is awarded to members of the British Armed Forces. They are awarded to those members who show the "most conspicuous bravery, or some daring or pre-eminent act of valour or self-sacrifice, or extreme devotion to duty in the presence of the enemy". This is definitely shown in our NHS staff.
attributes.background:
Many NHS staff are currently fighting on the front line against Coronavirus, and risking their lives every minute of every day to save lives and protect us. 
I believe this is a war against an invisible enemy, and our Doctors and Nurses are fighting to conquer it.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/312389

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.
 
Find out more: https://committees.parliament.uk/work/192/the-governments-response-to-coronavirus/
